title: In a Texas Border Town, Armed Groups Arrive to Look for Migrants
sub_head: State law that allows migrants to be arrested for trespassing draws armed citizens, in some cases welcomed by county officials
body:
BRACKETTVILLE, Texasâ€”As this South Texas border county has seen a jump in illegal border crossings, Sheriff Brad Coe is cooperating with groups of armed private citizens to help patrol the border and arrest migrants for trespassing.
The Kinney County sheriff has been in regular contact for months with a group of men donning body armor and rifles while patrolling to look for migrants. Another armed group offered use of a high-tech drone, and went on a patrol along with the sheriff. It has also pursued potential partnerships with private security firms.
